source_references: Statista: Most prescribed antibiotics in Russia 2020
BMC Pharmacology: Antibiotic use practices in Saint Petersburg

categories.russian_popular: Medications commonly used in Russia with no direct US equivalent or unique risk profile
categories.us_common: US medications frequently discussed in EN-RU medical interpreting
categories.antibiotics: Antibiotics with Russian trade names differing from US brands
categories.antihypertensives: Blood pressure medications with Russian trade name variants
categories.false_friends: Terms that sound similar in EN/RU but have different medical meanings

us_clinical_analog.notes: Phenobarbital is Schedule IV in US. Corvalol is a combination sedative/antispasmodic widely used in Russia for heart palpitations and anxiety.

clinical_warnings: Contains Phenobarbital (Schedule IV controlled substance in US)
Banned for import into US
Chronic use causes barbiturate dependence
CRITICAL: Must disclose to anesthesiologist before any surgery
medications.common_indications_ru: Тахикардия, бессонница, невроз, спазмы кишечника
medications.interpreter_notes: Extremely common in Russian households. Patients may not consider it a 'real medication' and fail to disclose. Always ask specifically.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Withdrawn from US market in 1977. Still widely available OTC in Russia.

clinical_warnings: Withdrawn from US market in 1977 due to agranulocytosis risk
Risk of severe blood disorder (agranulocytosis): 1 in 1,500 to 1 in 100,000
Banned or restricted in 30+ countries including US, UK, Sweden, Japan
medications.common_indications_ru: Головная боль, зубная боль, лихорадка, боли в суставах
medications.interpreter_notes: One of the most commonly used analgesics in Russia. US providers will not recognize it. Explain it is metamizole/dipyrone, withdrawn in the US.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Not FDA approved. Smooth muscle relaxant (antispasmodic). Closest US concept: Dicyclomine (Bentyl) for GI spasms, but different mechanism.

clinical_warnings: Not FDA approved, not available in US pharmacies
Widely used in Russia for menstrual cramps, GI spasms, urinary colic
Hypotension risk in elderly patients
medications.common_indications_ru: Спазмы ЖКТ, менструальные боли, почечная колика, спазмы мочевыводящих путей
medications.interpreter_notes: Extremely popular in Russia, especially among women. US providers will not know this drug. Explain mechanism and indication.

active_ingredients: Menthyl isovalerate (Menthol solution in menthyl ester of isovaleric acid)

us_clinical_analog.notes: Sublingual tablet used in Russia for chest pain and anxiety. Has NO proven cardiac efficacy. Purely a reflex sedative via menthol receptors.

clinical_warnings: HIGH RISK: No proven efficacy for angina or cardiac conditions
Patients may use Validol INSTEAD of nitroglycerin for chest pain
If patient reports using Validol for chest pain, flag for cardiac workup
Delays appropriate treatment for acute coronary syndrome
medications.common_indications_ru: Боли в сердце, тревожность, тошнота, укачивание
medications.interpreter_notes: CRITICAL: If patient says they take Validol for chest pain, this is a clinical red flag. It has no cardiac efficacy. The provider needs to know.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Very similar composition to Excedrin. Note: original Soviet Citramon also contained Phenacetin (carcinogen, removed in modern formulations).

clinical_warnings: Contains Aspirin: risk of GI bleeding, Reye syndrome in children
Contains Acetaminophen: hepatotoxicity risk if combined with other paracetamol products
Historical formulations contained Phenacetin (carcinogen, now removed)
medications.common_indications_ru: Головная боль, мигрень, зубная боль, боли в суставах, простуда
medications.interpreter_notes: Direct equivalent is Excedrin. Patients may not realize it contains Aspirin, which matters for bleeding risk and pre-surgical assessment.

us_clinical_analog.notes: US equivalents (Creon, Zenpep) require prescription. Mezym is OTC in Russia. Dosing may differ.

clinical_warnings: US equivalents are Rx-only (Creon, Zenpep, Pancreaze)
Mezym is OTC in Russia, patients may self-dose
High doses may cause hyperuricemia
medications.common_indications_ru: Нарушения пищеварения, хронический панкреатит, переедание, вздутие
medications.interpreter_notes: Very common OTC in Russia. US equivalent requires prescription. Inform provider of the patient's self-medication.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Russian antiviral. Efficacy not recognized by FDA, EMA, or WHO. Classified as 'insufficient evidence' by Cochrane review.

clinical_warnings: Efficacy not recognized by FDA, EMA, or WHO
Widely prescribed in Russia for influenza and COVID-19
Cochrane review: insufficient evidence of clinical benefit
Patients may believe they are 'protected' and delay seeking care
medications.common_indications_ru: Грипп, ОРВИ, профилактика вирусных инфекций, COVID-19
medications.interpreter_notes: Very commonly taken in Russia, especially during flu season. US providers will not recognize it. Explain it is a Russian antiviral with disputed efficacy internationally.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Nootropic. Banned by WADA (World Anti-Doping Agency). Not FDA approved. Used in Russia for cognitive enhancement and fatigue.

clinical_warnings: WADA banned substance (doping violation in competitive sports)
Not FDA approved
Stimulant properties may interact with other CNS medications
Patients may not disclose as they consider it a 'supplement'
medications.common_indications_ru: Когнитивные нарушения, астения, утомляемость, депрессия
medications.interpreter_notes: Nootropics are a major drug category in Russia with no US equivalent market. Patients may use several nootropics simultaneously.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Choleretic (bile flow stimulant). No equivalent category in US pharmacy. Closest concept: bile salt supplements (OTC, niche).

clinical_warnings: Contains animal bile (potential allergen)
Contraindicated in acute hepatitis, jaundice, cholelithiasis
No US equivalent category
medications.common_indications_ru: Хронический гепатит, дискинезия желчевыводящих путей, запоры
medications.interpreter_notes: Choleretics are a common medication category in Russia with no real US equivalent. Explain the concept: stimulates bile production to aid digestion.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Naphazoline exists in the US but is rarely used and largely discontinued for nasal use. Oxymetazoline (Afrin) is the US standard.

clinical_warnings: Extremely high addiction potential (rhinitis medicamentosa)
Rebound congestion after 3-5 days of use
Russian patients may use for months/years continuously
Pediatric overdose risk: potentially fatal in children
medications.common_indications_ru: Заложенность носа, ринит, синусит
medications.interpreter_notes: Naphthyzin addiction is a recognized problem in Russia. If patient mentions chronic nasal spray use, flag it.

us_clinical_analog.notes: 5-component analgesic. No US equivalent with this combination. Components exist individually in US. Risk of double-dosing paracetamol.

clinical_warnings: Contains Paracetamol: hepatotoxicity risk if combined with other acetaminophen products
Contains Naproxen: GI bleeding risk
5 active ingredients increase drug interaction risk
Older formulation contained Codeine (now reformulated)
medications.common_indications_ru: Головная боль, зубная боль, менструальные боли, невралгия, миалгия
medications.interpreter_notes: Complex multi-drug combination. US provider needs to know ALL 5 components for interaction checking.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Both are expectorants but different active ingredients. Mukaltin is herbal (marshmallow root). Mucinex is guaifenesin (synthetic).

clinical_warnings: Herbal product, not FDA evaluated
Generally well tolerated
May cause mild GI upset
medications.common_indications_ru: Кашель с мокротой, бронхит, трахеит
medications.interpreter_notes: Very common and inexpensive in Russia. Functional analog is Mucinex but different active ingredient. Low clinical risk.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Known in Russia by INN name. Russian trade names include Диротон (Diroton) and Лизинотон.

clinical_warnings: ACE inhibitor cough is common, may be described differently in Russian
Contraindicated in pregnancy
Russian trade name Диротон (Diroton) may not be recognized by US providers
medications.common_indications_ru: Артериальная гипертензия, сердечная недостаточность
medications.interpreter_notes: Same drug available in both countries. Watch for Russian trade name Diroton, which US providers will not recognize.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Омез (Omez) is a very popular Indian-manufactured brand in Russia. Identical to Prilosec.

clinical_warnings: Long-term PPI use associated with B12 deficiency, bone fracture risk
Russian patients may self-medicate for years without monitoring
medications.common_indications_ru: Язвенная болезнь, ГЭРБ, гастрит, изжога
medications.interpreter_notes: Same drug. Omez is the common Russian brand. Straightforward equivalence.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Identical combination. Amoksiklav is the most prescribed antibiotic in Russia (>11% of all antibiotic Rx).

clinical_warnings: Penicillin allergy cross-reactivity
Diarrhea common, C. difficile risk
Most prescribed antibiotic in Russia per Statista 2020
medications.common_indications_ru: Инфекции дыхательных путей, отит, синусит, инфекции мочевыводящих путей
medications.interpreter_notes: Direct equivalent is Augmentin. Straightforward translation.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Sumamed is the leading azithromycin brand in Russia (Pliva/Teva). Also sold as Азитрокс, Азитрал.

clinical_warnings: QT prolongation risk
Drug interactions with warfarin, digoxin
Most self-prescribed antibiotic class in Russia (macrolides at 33%)
Patients may have taken without prescription
medications.common_indications_ru: Инфекции дыхательных путей, ангина, отит, урогенитальные инфекции
medications.interpreter_notes: Sumamed = Zithromax. Also watch for Азитрокс (Azitrox) and Азитрал (Azitral) which are the same drug.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Flemoxin Solutab is a dispersible tablet form popular in Russia (especially pediatrics).

clinical_warnings: Penicillin allergy
Rash risk (especially with EBV/mononucleosis)
Dispersible form may confuse dosing discussions
medications.common_indications_ru: Инфекции дыхательных путей, отит, инфекции мочевыводящих путей, H. pylori
medications.interpreter_notes: Flemoxin Solutab = Amoxicillin. The 'Solutab' means dispersible tablet. Same active ingredient as Amoxil.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. In Russia, often sold as generic Цефтриаксон. Also brand name Азаран (Azaran).

clinical_warnings: IV/IM only (injection)
Cephalosporin allergy (cross-reactivity with penicillin ~1-2%)
Biliary sludge risk
Do not mix with calcium-containing solutions
medications.common_indications_ru: Пневмония, менингит, сепсис, инфекции мочевыводящих путей, гонорея
medications.interpreter_notes: Same drug as Rocephin. Russian patients may refer to it by generic name. Also watch for Азаран (Azaran).

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Ципролет (Ciprolet) is a common Indian-manufactured brand in Russia.

clinical_warnings: FDA Black Box Warning: tendon rupture, peripheral neuropathy, CNS effects
Fluoroquinolone resistance is high in Russia
Drug interactions with antacids, dairy, warfarin
QT prolongation risk
medications.common_indications_ru: Инфекции мочевыводящих путей, инфекции ЖКТ, остеомиелит, простатит
medications.interpreter_notes: Same drug as Cipro. The FDA black box warnings are critical. Russian prescribing may be more liberal with fluoroquinolones.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Rarely used systemically in US due to aplastic anemia risk. Still widely available OTC in Russia as eye drops and tablets.

clinical_warnings: CRITICAL: Risk of fatal aplastic anemia (idiosyncratic, dose-independent)
Rarely used systemically in US since the 1960s
Still used OTC in Russia for GI infections and eye infections
Gray baby syndrome in neonates
medications.common_indications_ru: Кишечные инфекции, конъюнктивит, гнойные раны
medications.interpreter_notes: HIGH RISK: Levomitsetin is chloramphenicol. If patient is taking it systemically, US provider needs to know immediately. Aplastic anemia risk.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Identical combination. Biseptol is the classic Russian/Eastern European brand name.

clinical_warnings: Sulfa allergy (common)
Stevens-Johnson syndrome risk
Hyperkalemia risk
G6PD deficiency: hemolytic anemia risk
medications.common_indications_ru: Инфекции мочевыводящих путей, бронхит, отит, кишечные инфекции
medications.interpreter_notes: Biseptol = Bactrim/Septra. Very well known in Russian-speaking countries. Straightforward equivalence.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Таваник (Tavanik) is the Sanofi brand sold in Russia.

clinical_warnings: FDA Black Box Warning: tendon rupture, peripheral neuropathy, CNS effects
QT prolongation
Heavily used for COVID-19 in Russia (self-medication)
Drug interactions with antacids, NSAIDs, warfarin
medications.common_indications_ru: Пневмония, бронхит, синусит, инфекции мочевыводящих путей, COVID-19
medications.interpreter_notes: Tavanik = Levaquin. Same FDA black box warnings as ciprofloxacin.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Клацид (Klacid) is the Abbott brand used in Russia.

clinical_warnings: QT prolongation
Significant CYP3A4 interactions (statins, benzodiazepines)
Metallic taste common side effect
FDA warning: increased risk of heart problems years after use
medications.common_indications_ru: Инфекции дыхательных путей, H. pylori (в комбинации), инфекции кожи
medications.interpreter_notes: Klacid = Biaxin. Used heavily in H. pylori triple therapy in Russia.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug, same brand name. Супракс is transliterated directly.

clinical_warnings: Cephalosporin allergy
Oral third-gen cephalosporin: use contributes to ESBL resistance
GI side effects common
medications.common_indications_ru: Инфекции дыхательных путей, отит, инфекции мочевыводящих путей, гонорея
medications.interpreter_notes: Supraks = Suprax. One of the few brand names that transliterate directly.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Still widely used in Russia (oral and injection). Largely replaced by amoxicillin in US outpatient practice.

clinical_warnings: Penicillin allergy
Less bioavailable orally than amoxicillin
Rash with EBV/mononucleosis
Still commonly prescribed in Russia where amoxicillin might be preferred in US
medications.common_indications_ru: Инфекции дыхательных путей, менингит, эндокардит, инфекции мочевыводящих путей
medications.interpreter_notes: Same drug exists in US but is used less frequently in outpatient settings. Provider may switch to amoxicillin.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Фурадонин is a very commonly self-prescribed UTI treatment in Russia.

clinical_warnings: Pulmonary toxicity with long-term use
Peripheral neuropathy risk
Contraindicated in renal impairment (GFR <30)
Frequently self-prescribed by Russian women for UTI
medications.common_indications_ru: Инфекции мочевыводящих путей, цистит
medications.interpreter_notes: Furadonin = Macrobid. Very commonly self-treated in Russia for UTIs without seeing a doctor.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Энап (Enap) is the dominant enalapril brand in Russia (KRKA). Also sold as Ренитек, Берлиприл.

clinical_warnings: ACE inhibitor cough
Angioedema risk
Contraindicated in pregnancy
Hyperkalemia risk
medications.common_indications_ru: Артериальная гипертензия, сердечная недостаточность
medications.interpreter_notes: Enap = Vasotec (enalapril). One of the most prescribed antihypertensives in Russia. Also watch for Ренитек (Renitec) and Берлиприл (Berlipril).

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Конкор (Concor) by Merck is the dominant bisoprolol brand in Russia. Also sold as Коронал, Бисопролол.

clinical_warnings: Do NOT stop abruptly (rebound tachycardia/hypertension)
Bradycardia risk
Mask hypoglycemia in diabetics
Bronchospasm in asthmatics at higher doses
medications.common_indications_ru: Артериальная гипертензия, ИБС, хроническая сердечная недостаточность, аритмия
medications.interpreter_notes: Concor = Zebeta (bisoprolol). Extremely common in Russia. Also watch for Коронал (Coronal).

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug, same brand name. Widely used in Russia as sublingual emergency antihypertensive for hypertensive crises.

clinical_warnings: Used sublingually in Russia for hypertensive crises (not standard US practice)
Rapid blood pressure drop can cause stroke in elderly
ACE inhibitor cough and angioedema risk
Short-acting: requires multiple daily doses
medications.common_indications_ru: Гипертонический криз, артериальная гипертензия, сердечная недостаточность
medications.interpreter_notes: Same brand name in both countries. Important: Russian patients often take it sublingually for 'crisis' situations, which is a different usage pattern than US standard.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Лозап (Lozap) is a common Eastern European brand (Zentiva). Also sold as Лориста, Козаар, Лозартан.

clinical_warnings: Contraindicated in pregnancy
Hyperkalemia risk (especially with ACE inhibitors or K-sparing diuretics)
Less cough than ACE inhibitors
medications.common_indications_ru: Артериальная гипертензия, диабетическая нефропатия, сердечная недостаточность
medications.interpreter_notes: Lozap = Cozaar (losartan). Also watch for Лориста (Lorista) and Козаар.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Коринфар (Corinfar) is a common brand in Russia. Short-acting form still used in Russia for crises (not recommended in US).

clinical_warnings: SHORT-ACTING nifedipine used sublingually in Russia for crises
US guidelines: short-acting nifedipine is DANGEROUS, can cause stroke/MI
Reflex tachycardia
Extended-release form (Procardia XL) is safe and standard in US
medications.common_indications_ru: Гипертонический криз, артериальная гипертензия, стенокардия
medications.interpreter_notes: CRITICAL: If patient describes taking nifedipine sublingually for 'crisis', alert provider. This practice is discouraged in US due to unpredictable hypotension and stroke risk.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Норваск (Norvasc) is used in both countries. Generic Амлодипин is widely available in Russia.

clinical_warnings: Peripheral edema (common, dose-dependent)
Dizziness, flushing
Long half-life: takes 7-8 days to reach steady state
medications.common_indications_ru: Артериальная гипертензия, стенокардия
medications.interpreter_notes: Norvasc is one of the few brands recognized in both countries. Straightforward.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Эгилок (Egilok) by Egis is the dominant metoprolol brand in Russia. Also Беталок (Betaloc).

clinical_warnings: Do NOT stop abruptly
Tartrate vs. Succinate formulations have different dosing
Bradycardia, fatigue, depression risk
Mask hypoglycemia in diabetics
medications.common_indications_ru: Артериальная гипертензия, стенокардия, аритмия, профилактика мигрени
medications.interpreter_notes: Egilok = Lopressor/Toprol-XL (metoprolol). Also watch for Беталок (Betaloc) and Вазокардин (Vasocardin).

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Престариум (Prestarium) is the Servier brand widely prescribed in Russia.

clinical_warnings: ACE inhibitor cough and angioedema
Contraindicated in pregnancy
Often combined with Indapamide in Russia (Нолипрел / Noliprel)
medications.common_indications_ru: Артериальная гипертензия, сердечная недостаточность, профилактика инсульта
medications.interpreter_notes: Prestarium = Aceon (perindopril). Watch for combo drug Нолипрел (Noliprel) = perindopril + indapamide.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Анаприлин is the traditional Russian name for propranolol. Very commonly self-prescribed for anxiety and tremor.

clinical_warnings: Non-selective: bronchospasm risk in asthmatics
Do NOT stop abruptly
Frequently self-prescribed in Russia for performance anxiety, tremor
Mask hypoglycemia symptoms
medications.common_indications_ru: Тахикардия, артериальная гипертензия, тремор, мигрень, тревожность
medications.interpreter_notes: Anaprilin = Inderal (propranolol). Commonly taken by Russian patients for anxiety without prescription.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Арифон (Arifon) is the Servier brand in Russia. Widely prescribed as thiazide-like diuretic.

clinical_warnings: Hypokalemia risk
Hyponatremia (especially elderly)
Gout exacerbation
Often combined with perindopril (Нолипрел / Noliprel)
medications.common_indications_ru: Артериальная гипертензия, отёки при сердечной недостаточности
medications.interpreter_notes: Arifon = Lozol (indapamide). Also common in combo Нолипрел (perindopril + indapamide).

us_clinical_analog.notes: Never approved by FDA. Withdrawn in several EU countries due to hepatotoxicity. Still widely available OTC in Russia.

clinical_warnings: CRITICAL: Hepatotoxicity risk (liver failure reported)
Never approved by FDA
Withdrawn or restricted in Finland, Spain, Ireland, and others
Still OTC in Russia, India, and many other countries
Patients may not disclose as they consider it routine
medications.common_indications_ru: Боли в суставах, зубная боль, головная боль, менструальные боли, лихорадка
medications.interpreter_notes: HIGH RISK: Nimesulide is NOT available in US and has been withdrawn in parts of Europe for liver damage. If patient is taking Найз or Нимесил, provider must know.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. In US, ketorolac is limited to max 5 days (injection/oral). In Russia, Кеторол and Кетанов are widely used OTC for longer periods.

clinical_warnings: US: Max 5 days total use due to GI bleeding and renal risk
Russian patients may take for weeks (exceeding safe US limits)
Most potent NSAID analgesic (rivals opioids for pain)
GI bleeding, renal impairment, platelet inhibition
medications.common_indications_ru: Сильная боль (зубная, послеоперационная, травматическая), невралгия
medications.interpreter_notes: Ketorol/Ketanov = Toradol (ketorolac). If patient reports prolonged use, flag for provider. US limits to 5 days max.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Available in US as Rx oral and OTC topical gel. In Russia, all forms including oral and injectable are widely available.

clinical_warnings: Cardiovascular risk (MI, stroke) with prolonged use
GI bleeding risk
Injectable form commonly used in Russia (rare in US outpatient)
Ортофен (Ortofen) is an older Soviet-era brand name still in use
medications.common_indications_ru: Артрит, остеохондроз, боли в спине, послеоперационные боли, подагра
medications.interpreter_notes: Voltaren brand is known in both countries. Watch for Ортофен (Ortofen), an older Soviet-era brand US providers will not recognize.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Нурофен (Nurofen) by Reckitt is the dominant ibuprofen brand in Russia.

clinical_warnings: GI bleeding risk
Renal impairment with chronic use
Cardiovascular risk with prolonged high-dose use
Drug interaction with aspirin (reduces cardioprotective effect)
medications.common_indications_ru: Головная боль, зубная боль, менструальные боли, лихорадка, артрит
medications.interpreter_notes: Nurofen = Advil/Motrin (ibuprofen). Straightforward. Universal familiarity.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Ketoprofen OTC was removed from US market. Still widely used in Russia in oral, injectable, and topical forms.

clinical_warnings: Photosensitivity (especially topical gel)
GI bleeding risk
OTC form discontinued in US (still Rx)
Injectable form common in Russia
medications.common_indications_ru: Артрит, остеохондроз, послеоперационные боли, травмы, невралгия
medications.interpreter_notes: Ketonal = ketoprofen (Orudis). Exists in US but less commonly used. Provider will recognize the generic name.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug. Мовалис (Movalis) is the Boehringer Ingelheim brand in Russia. 20+ years of use in Russian clinical practice.

clinical_warnings: Lower GI risk than non-selective NSAIDs
Cardiovascular risk with prolonged use
Renal impairment risk
Popular in Russia for chronic joint disease
medications.common_indications_ru: Остеоартроз, ревматоидный артрит, анкилозирующий спондилит
medications.interpreter_notes: Movalis = Mobic (meloxicam). One of the most commonly used NSAIDs in Russia for chronic conditions.

us_clinical_analog.notes: Same drug, different naming convention. Russia/Europe: Paracetamol. US: Acetaminophen. Critical distinction for patient communication.

clinical_warnings: NAMING RISK: Paracetamol = Acetaminophen = Tylenol (patient may not realize)
Hepatotoxicity: max 4g/day (lower in liver disease or alcohol use)
Present in MANY combination drugs (Pentalgin, Citramon, cold remedies)
Double-dosing risk when taking multiple combination products
medications.common_indications_ru: Головная боль, лихорадка, простуда, боли
medications.interpreter_notes: CRITICAL NAMING: Patient says 'paracetamol', provider hears unfamiliar term. Translate as 'acetaminophen / Tylenol'. Also flag combination product risk.

us_clinical_analog.notes: COX-2 selective inhibitor by Merck. FDA declined approval in 2007 citing cardiovascular concerns. Approved in 60+ countries including Russia.

clinical_warnings: FDA DECLINED approval (2007) due to cardiovascular risk concerns
Available in Russia and most of EU
Same drug class as Vioxx (rofecoxib, withdrawn for heart attack risk)
Hypertension, edema, cardiovascular event risk
medications.common_indications_ru: Остеоартроз, ревматоидный артрит, подагра, анкилозирующий спондилит
medications.interpreter_notes: NOT available in US. FDA specifically declined approval. Provider needs to know patient is on a COX-2 inhibitor and assess cardiovascular risk.

false_friends.ru_meaning: Sore throat / Tonsillitis (acute inflammation of the tonsils)
false_friends.en_false_cognate: Angina pectoris (chest pain due to coronary artery disease)
false_friends.clinical_consequence: Patient says 'ангина' meaning sore throat. Provider hears 'angina' and initiates cardiac workup. Or vice versa: provider asks about 'angina' meaning chest pain, patient denies because they interpret it as sore throat.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: ALWAYS translate 'ангина' as 'tonsillitis' or 'sore throat', NEVER as 'angina'. If the provider says 'angina', translate as 'боль в груди / стенокардия'.

false_friends.clinical_consequence: Patient says 'мне делали наркоз' (I was given anesthesia). Provider may hear 'narcotics' and suspect substance use.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Translate 'наркоз' as 'general anesthesia', never as 'narcotics'. If provider asks about 'narcotics', translate as 'наркотические вещества / наркотики'.

false_friends.clinical_consequence: Patient says 'у меня был инсульт' (I had a stroke). Untrained listener hears 'insult'.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Always translate 'инсульт' as 'stroke' or 'CVA'. Never as 'insult'.

false_friends.clinical_consequence: In Russian medical context, 'интоксикация' usually means general poisoning or toxicity (food poisoning, medication toxicity, chemical exposure). In English, 'intoxication' primarily implies alcohol or drug impairment.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Translate 'интоксикация' as 'poisoning' or 'toxicity' depending on context. Specify the cause. If alcohol is meant, Russian would say 'алкогольное опьянение'.

false_friends.clinical_consequence: Minor confusion risk. Patient says 'у меня есть рецепт' (I have a prescription). Unlikely to cause clinical harm but can slow communication.
Minimal risk. 'Процедурный кабинет' = treatment room. May cause momentary confusion.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Translate 'кабинет' as 'office' or 'examination room' in medical context.

false_friends.en_false_cognate: None directly, but patients may confuse with 'поликлиника' (polyclinic/outpatient clinic)
false_friends.clinical_consequence: Russian healthcare distinguishes between больница (hospital, inpatient) and поликлиника (outpatient clinic). US system does not have a direct 'polyclinic' equivalent. Patients may use terms interchangeably.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Clarify: 'больница' = hospital (inpatient), 'поликлиника' = outpatient clinic, 'скорая помощь' = ambulance/ER.

false_friends.clinical_consequence: Provider says 'be accurate with dosing'. If transliterated rather than translated, patient may understand 'be neat/tidy' instead of 'be precise'.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Translate 'accurate' as 'точный', not 'аккуратный'. Translate 'аккуратный' as 'careful' or 'neat'.

false_friends.en_false_cognate: Sympathetic (compassionate / relating to sympathetic nervous system)
false_friends.clinical_consequence: In medical context, 'sympathetic' relates to the sympathetic nervous system. If transliterated, could cause confusion in neurological or pharmacological discussion.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Translate 'sympathetic nervous system' as 'симпатическая нервная система' (different word). Never transliterate.

false_friends.ru_meaning: Home nursing visit / community health nurse visit (especially for newborns and chronically ill)
false_friends.clinical_consequence: Patient mentions 'патронажная сестра' (community health nurse). May be misunderstood if transliterated.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Translate 'патронаж' as 'home nurse visit' or 'community health visit'. 'Патронажная сестра' = 'visiting nurse'.

false_friends.ru_meaning: Length of work experience / duration of disease
false_friends.clinical_consequence: Doctor asks about disease 'стаж' (how long has the patient had the condition). Could be confused with 'stage' (стадия) of disease. 'Стаж диабета 10 лет' = 'has had diabetes for 10 years', NOT 'stage 10 diabetes'.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Translate 'стаж заболевания' as 'duration of illness' or 'how long the patient has had the condition'. 'Стадия' = 'stage'.

false_friends.en_false_cognate: Could be confused with 'obstipation' (which exists in English but is rarely used) or misheard as other terms
false_friends.clinical_consequence: Minor. The English medical term 'obstipation' does exist and means severe constipation, but is rarely used in everyday clinical practice.
false_friends.interpreter_guidance: Translate as 'severe constipation' or 'complete constipation'. The English cognate exists but explain in plain language.
